snippet: On the remote Makah reservation, visitors can experience an area’s stormy euphoria and gloom — and still catch the ferry home for dinner.
abstract: Makah Indian Reservation Journal; remote Makah Indian Reservation in Washington State is the site of the most northwesterly piece of earth in the contiguous United States, and offers visitors the opportunity to experience the area's elements of extreme euphoria and gloom and still catch the ferry home; tribe is promoting heavily to storm tourists; winter is prime storm tourism season, when the winds are at their fiercest; after several years of flat or declining tourism, the new outreach is making a difference.
lead_paragraph: On the remote Makah reservation, visitors can experience an area’s stormy euphoria and gloom — and still catch the ferry home for dinner.

headline.seo: Washington Outpost Draws Those Seeking Slap of Sea Spray
headline.main: Washington Outpost Draws Those Hungry for Slap of Sea Spray
headline.print_headline: Outpost Draws Explorers Hungry for Slap of Sea Spray
